title: Joey DeFrancesco - All About My Girl
description:
Joey DeFrancesco - All About My Girl

This album is about, to quote jazz organ giant Joey DeFrancesco, 'to get together and do what we love, playing blues and standards'.

Release: 1994
Label: Muse Records

Tracklist:
01. Grilled Cheese and Bacon (9:33)
02. Polka Dots and Moonbeams (6:59)
03. Donna Lee (5:48)
04. Alone Together (7:07)
05. Save Your Love for Me (6:12)
06. Blues for Joe F. (6:55)
07. When Sonny Gets Blue (5:43)
08. All About My Girl (4:28)

Total Time: 52:45

Personnel:
- Joey DeFrancesco - Hammond B3 organ,
- Houston Person - tenor saxophone (tracks 1-2, 4-7),
- Paul Bollenback - guitar,
- Byron Landham - drums.

Recorded at Van Gelder Recording Studio, Englewood Cliffs, NJ on March 9, 1994.

Format: MP3 320 kbit/s. All songs are tagged by the book.

--------

This is swinging, exciting playing that equals any organ group you have heard. Tenor sax player Houston Person adds immeasurably to this group with his soulful playing. Joey's long-time associates Paul Bollenback on guitar and Byron Landham on drums cannot be improved on. The album title 'All About My Girl' is somewhat deceptive in that the songs are not all about girls, although we hear about 'Donna Lee' and 'Sonny Gets Blue'. To quote Joey, it is more about wanting 'to get together and do what we love, playing blues and standards'. In fact, Joey calls this one of his favorite albums. Good luck in finding this out of print Muse label recording.

L Hammond, The Pirate Bay, where you'll find more jazz organ.
